intro: I build a lego prototype with a space for the micro:bit to fit in. My prototype has added wheels to make it more portable. The idea is to increase its portability to far-flung area. It also has plants to make it look more beautiful. I also added a disco ball to make it stylish.
intro_items: I build a lego prototype with a space for the micro:bit to fit in.

My prototype has added wheels to make it more portable. The idea is to increase its portability to far-flung area. It also has plants to make it look more beautiful. I also added a disco ball to make it stylish.
materiaux:
Supplies
  • Lego
  • Micro:Bit and buzzer
  • Makecode program (software)
  • Battery and wires
  • Ruler to measure prototype

etapes.html:
1. Step 1:

Étapes :

  1. We research and view a few past prototype examples that use materials like paper cups and cut out milk bottles that can allow sound to amplify.

2. Step 2:

Étapes :

  1. We experiment using lego pieces that I think reflect a sustainable building which can allow a buzzer to amplify sound. A buzzer about 1.5cm x 1.5 cm which is small enough to be slot inside the prototype. You can build your own design. But must have some hollows for sound particle to vibrate and travel out.
